availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Tilford Simmons Crow (Bullitt County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier)

body.p: Bullitt County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Bullitt County, Kentucky, native. Son of Alfred Crow. Owned by John Simmons in Bullitt County, Kentucky. Laborer in Bullitt County in 1864. Served in the 122nd United States Colored Infantry Regiment as a private from October 17, 1864, to February 8, 1866.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Military Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in the United States Colored Troops: 122nd USCT Infantry, 1864-1866, NARA RG 94, Roll RG94-USCT-122-Bx36.
Freedman's Bank Records, 1865-1874, NARA RG 101, Louisville, Kentucky, Roll 11, September 15, 1865-July 8, 1874, p. 366.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994027-994058, Jefferson County Deaths, p. 228.
